SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.routing

Interface RouteHandler

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface RouteHandler
A functional interface representing a handler for a matched route.

The handle method accepts a JoltContext and returns an object, which might be used as the response body in Jolt.

If a route should return a simple static response, you can convert a Supplier to a RouteHandler using fromSupplier(Supplier).

Since:
1.0
See Also:
  • JoltContext
  • Route

    Method
    Description
    static RouteHandler

  • Method Details

    • handle

      JoltContext handle(JoltContext ctx) throws JoltRoutingException
      The main method invoked when a request matches a route.

      This method receives a JoltContext allowing access to request data (e.g., path/query parameters, body, etc.) and response methods (e.g., setting headers or cookies).

      Parameters:
      ctx - The request/response context object for this route.
      Returns:
      An object, which may be used as the response body by the Jolt framework.
      Throws:
      JoltRoutingException - If an error occurs during the routing or handling process.

    • fromSupplier

      static RouteHandler fromSupplier(Supplier<JoltContext> supplier)
      Converts a Supplier returning an Object into a RouteHandler. This is useful for routes that produce a simple static or memoized response and do not need direct access to the JoltContext.
      Parameters:
      supplier - A supplier returning the object to be used as the response body.
      Returns:
      A RouteHandler that ignores the context and uses the supplied object's value.
